alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Madison; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN LEWIS, NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE, PICKAWAY, PIKE, SCIOTO, SOUTHEASTERN MADISON AND ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, showers were located along a line extending from near New Holland to near Wheelersburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Portsmouth, Circleville, Wheelersburg, Waverly, Ashville, New Boston, Piketon, Mount Sterling, South Bloomfield, Kingston, Williamsport, South Webster, New Holland, Rosemount, Clarktown, Lucasville, Franklin Furnace, Logan Elm Village and Pike Lake. This includes I-71 in Ohio near mile marker 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
